scraped_articles.content:
5 Clown Scary Movies for Your Big Top Nightmares

Let's dim the lights and prepare for a night of fright with these clown-scary movies. This list will leave you sleeping with one eye open. (Photo: pinterest/FerMe'l Design - Unigue Creative Designs)

5 Clown Scary Movies for Your Big Top Nightmares

Clowns have long been a staple of horror movies, with their painted faces and outsized smiles sending shivers down viewers' spines. If you're looking for a night of big top nightmares, we've covered you with five clown-scary movies. 

These horror movies will have you on the edge of your seat. From the classic terror of "It" to the bizarre antics, there's something for everyone on this list. Let's check it out!

Clown Scary Movies

  • Genre: Horror/Mystery
  • IMDb: 7,3/10
  • Rotten Tomatoes: 85%

1. It (2017)

First up, we have "It" and its sequel, "It Chapter Two," based on Stephen King's novel. "It" movie follows a group of kids terrorized by a shape-shifting clown named Pennywise. You can catch this film on various streaming platforms like Amazon Prime Video or Hulu.

  • Genre: Horror/Mystery
  • IMDb: 6,5/10
  • Rotten Tomatoes: 62%

2. It Chapter Two (2019)

Continuing the story of Pennywise the Dancing Clown, "It Chapter Two" sees the now-adult members of the Losers' Club. They return to Derry to face their childhood fears again.

You can find this movie on HBO Max or rent it on platforms like Google Play Movies.

3. Killer Klowns from Outer Space (1988)

  • Genre: Horror/Comedy
  • IMDb: 6,2/10
  • Rotten Tomatoes: 78%

"Killer Klowns from Outer Space" is a must-watch for a more comedic take on clown horror. This cult classic follows a group of aliens who resemble clowns and terrorize a small town. You can stream this movie on platforms like Amazon Prime Video or Tubi.

4. Terrifier 2 (2022)

  • Genre: Horror/Slasher
  • IMDb: 6,1/10
  • Rotten Tomatoes: 86%

If you're looking for something more recent, "Terrifier 2" is the movie for you.

This highly anticipated sequel follows the return of Art the Clown. He is a sadistic killer who wreaks havoc on Halloween night. You can catch this movie in theaters or on VOD platforms like Amazon Prime Video.

5. House of 1000 Corpses (2003)

  • Genre: Horror/Comedy
  • IMDb: 6/10
  • Google Users: 77%

Lastly, we have "House of 1000 Corpses," directed by Rob Zombie. This movie still features a terrifying clown character named Captain Spaulding. The film follows a group of friends who stumble upon a family of sadistic killers. You can watch this movie on platforms like Netflix or Shudder.

If you're in the mood for some spine-chilling clown horror, these movies will scare you silly. Grab some popcorn and get ready for a night of big top nightmares!

Each film presents its unique take on the creepy clown, ensuring that there's something for everyone.

Let's dim the lights, grab your blanket, and prepare for a night of fright with these clown-scary movies. This list will leave you sleeping with one eye open. Check where you can stream each film and prepare for a thrilling ride through the twisted world of clown horror. Happy watching!

Clown Scary Movies

scraped_articles.title: This Tunnels in Las Vegas is Only For Teslas
scraped_articles.meta_description: This Tesla tunnel is known as Elon Musk's 'Vegas Loop.'
scraped_articles.content:
This Tunnels in Las Vegas is Only For Teslas

This tunnel is known as Elon Musk's 'Vegas Loop.'

This Tunnels in Las Vegas is Only For Teslas

People are confused by the underground tunnel specifically for Tesla. 

This tunnel is known as Elon Musk's 'Vegas Loop.'

The Boring Company built it for fast transportation in Las Vegas.

Elon Musk's company claims the Vegas Loop will pass more than 90,000 Tesla per hour.

The tunnel is 68 miles long and has 93 stations approved by Clark County and the City of Las Vegas.

A TikTok video showing a Tesla driving through the Vegas Loop sparked a different reaction. 

Some feel narrow, while others are enchanted by the colorful lights.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 📍Atlanta,GA (@upscaleluxury)

Tesla's drivers who use these tunnels can avoid traffic jams. According to UNILAD, The Boring Company plans to expand to Los Angeles. 

Some users said it was similar to a movie scene. Some are worried or think it is not efficient.

The Boring Company explains that the Loop is an express public transportation system. 

It looks more like an underground highway than a subway.

It allows drivers to travel directly to their destination without stopping at middle stations. 

That makes it faster than traditional subway cars. The car can reach up to 150 mph compared to 65 mph.

scraped_articles.title: 5 Haunted Places In Maine To Feel Mystical State In The Easternmost Part
scraped_articles.meta_description: These haunted places in Maine will make you feel like you're in a mystical state in the easternmost part of the US.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: spooky,horror,ghost,ghostly,Haunted Places In Maine,Maine,Most Haunted Places in Maine,haunted,timeless,Article,Mystic
scraped_articles.content:
5 Haunted Places In Maine To Feel Mystical State In The Easternmost Part

f you're up for a ghostly adventure, visit these spooky spots and see if you can spot any restless spirits walking around. (Photo: S.Rohit Pandit on pinterest)

5 Haunted Places In Maine To Feel Mystical State In The Easternmost Part

Maine is the northeasternmost state in the United States. It is known not only for its picturesque landscapes and delicious lobster rolls, but Maine is also suited to its haunted places that will send shivers down your spine.

From historic inns to old prisons, Maine is home to several spooky spots said to be inhabited by restless spirits. If you're feeling brave enough, here are five haunted places in Maine. These sites will make you feel the mystical state of the easternmost part.


Haunted Places In Maine

Photo: flickr/Ballroompics

1. Carriage House Inn, Searsport

This charming inn is said to be haunted by the ghost of a young girl. She tragically lost her life in a fire many years ago. Guests have reported hearing footsteps and seeing flickering lights. Some eerie experiences make it a must-visit for those seeking a spooky experience.

Photo: flickr/Paul VanDerWerf

2. Fort William Henry

Located in Cape Elizabeth, Fort William Henry is known for its ghostly encounters. Visitors have reported feeling a sense of unease and hearing strange noises within the fort walls. Rumor has it that the spirits of soldiers who died during battle still roam the grounds.

wikipedia

3. Parson Center, Museum of Old York

The Parson Center in York is said to be haunted by the ghost of Reverend George Burdett, who was the first minister of York. Visitors have reported seeing his ghostly figure roaming the halls. Some also hear disembodied voices whispering in the night.

4. Maine State Prison, Thomaston

Once a place of incarceration, Maine State Prison in Thomaston is now rumored to be haunted by the spirits of ex-inmates. Visitors have reported hearing phantom footsteps and feeling cold spots throughout the prison grounds. Spooky tells us it is making it a spine-chilling destination for ghost hunters.

Photo: flickr/Robert English

5. The Kennebec Arsenal

This historic military site in Augusta is said to be haunted by the spirits of soldiers who perished during battle. Visitors have reported seeing shadowy figures. Some also hear mysterious voices echoing through the old buildings, adding to the eerie atmosphere of the Arsenal.

Do you believe in the supernatural or not? These haunted places in Maine will make you feel like you're in a mystical state in the easternmost part of the US.

So, if you're up for a ghostly adventure, visit these spooky spots and see if you can spot any restless spirits walking around.

Remember to keep an open mind and maybe bring a flashlight – just in case you need to light your way through the dark corridors of these haunted places in Maine.

Haunted Places In Maine

scraped_articles.title: 45 Mike Tyson Quotes: Punchy Words To Light Up Your Spirit
scraped_articles.meta_description: These Mike Tyson quotes are as powerful as his punch. These quotes will light up your spirit and push you to pursue your dreams.
scraped_articles.content:
45 Mike Tyson Quotes: Punchy Words To Light Up Your Spirit

If you are a die-hard boxing fan or just need an extra kick of motivation in your life, you should check out our collection of the strongest Mike Tyson quotes.

45 Mike Tyson Quotes: Punchy Words To Light Up Your Spirit

Mike Tyson is one of the most successful and famous boxers in history. Even non-boxing fans know about him. Besides being famous for his heavy punch, Mike Tyson is also known for his strong quotes.

Mike Tyson quotes full of super-strong punches. These quotes will slap your face, set your soul on fire, and motivate you to work hard to make your dreams come true.

In this article, we have selected some of the best and strongest Mike Tyson quotes from various sources, Wednesday (22/11/2023). These quotes are perfect if you're looking for something to light up your spirit to pursue your aspirations.

A. Wise Mike Tyson Quotes

1. "Everybody you fight is not your enemy and everybody who helps you is not your friend." - Mike Tyson

2. "Fighting is a sport; if you're not humble it's going to bring humbleness to you." - Mike Tyson

3. "A man that is a friend to everyone is an enemy to himself." - Mike Tyson

4. "Everyone has a plan 'till they get punched in the mouth." - Mike Tyson

5. "At one point, I thought life was about acquiring things. But as a I get older, life is totally about losing everything." - Mike Tyson

6. "If you're not humble, life will visit humbleness upon you." - Mike Tyson

7. "There's nothing to fear but fear itself. It's an illusion of fear. Fear is an illusion. If you gonna die, you gonna die anyway; it's not something to fear, fear is not gonna help." - Mike Tyson

8. "I try my best to learn from other people's mistakes. I have a lot of respect for people who can change." - Mike Tyson

9. "Sometimes, the people we invest the most time in disappoint us the most." - Mike Tyson


10. "Every win, regardless a good or bad one, gives you more confidence." - Mike Tyson

11. "The tempt for greatness is the biggest drug in the world." - Mike Tyson

12. "It's good to know how to read, but it's dangerous to know how to read and not how to interpret what you're reading." - Mike Tyson

13. "In order to be a friend to anybody, you have to be a friend to yourself. If you're not a friend to yourself, there's no way you're gonna have any friends." - Mike Tyson

14. "What I've done in the past is history and what I'm gonna do in the future is a mystery" - Mike Tyson

15. "Treat the world the way you want to be treated." - Mike Tyson

B. Motivational Mike Tyson Quotes

1. "Discipline is doing what you hate to do, but nonetheless doing it like you love it." - Mike Tyson

2. "In order to succeed greatly, you have to be prepared to fail greatly. If you can't do both of them, you've got a problem." - Mike Tyson

3. "As long as we persevere and endure, we can get anything we want." - Mike Tyson

4. "You never lose until you actually give up." - Mike Tyson

5. "Confidence breeds success & success breeds confidence... Confidence applied properly surpasses genius." - Mike Tyson

6. "God lets everything happen for a reason. It's all a learning process, and you have to go from one level to another." - Mike Tyson

7. "You need to learn independence. You have to be independent - it builds character." - Mike Tyson

8. "Any man can do what he has to do. But doing it like you love it? That is what takes it to a whole different level. A champion does it like he loves it, even when he doesn't." - Mike Tyson

9. "There's nothing like confidence." - Mike Tyson

10. "In order for me to achieve... I had to regard myself greater than what I was. In other words I had to fake it until I make it."

- Mike Tyson

11. "You have to compete in life because if you don't have no competition - no competition, no spirit, you know, you'll fall under the slightest struggle."

- Mike Tyson

© 2023 trstdly.com

12. "As human beings, nobody gets out of this world free. We all have to do some suffering before we leave." - Mike Tyson

13. "Hard times fall upon everybody. Whatever it is, we're going to get out of it." - Mike Tyson

14. "There's no future in our past. Just experience. We want to return to it, but we don't want to close the door on it either." - Mike Tyson

15. "I'm a dreamer. I have to dream and reach for the stars, and if I miss a star then I grab a handful of clouds." - Mike Tyson

C. The Most Iconic Mike Tyson Quotes

scraped_articles.title: 8 Most Haunted Places in Kansas City
scraped_articles.meta_description: 8 Most Haunted Places in Kansas City; from asylum to wine house!
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: 8 Most Haunted Places in Kansas City
scraped_articles.content:
8 Most Haunted Places in Kansas City

8 Most Haunted Places in Kansas City

Kansas City is a place with a lot of interesting history and some seriously spooky spots with ghostly tales. Let's dive into eight haunted locations that have captured people's imaginations

Swipe Up to Learn More!

Belvoir Winery & Inn

Built in 1900, this winery was once a home for the elderly. Now, visitors report seeing ghosts, including an old singing woman and mischievous children. Strange noises and self-playing pianos add to the mystery.

Brown Mansion, Coffeyville

A mansion built in 1888 by W.P. Brown, it tells a sad story of the Brown family. Ghostly sightings include Violet dancing, Donald playing, and Nancy crying. W.P. is often spotted smoking his pipe.

Elms Hotel and Spa

Dating back to 1888, this hotel hosted infamous figures like "Pretty Boy" Floyd and Al Capone. Guests claim encounters with ghosts, including a maid from the 1920s and a frantic woman searching for her child.

Ellis Railroad Museum, Ellis

Home to railroad memorabilia and dolls, the museum has a ghost named Earl Perkins. Strange noises and ghostly figures are reported by staff and visitors.

Fort Leavenworth

Established in 1827, Fort Leavenworth is known for the ghost of Catherine Rich, searching for her lost children near the cemetery.

Garden of Eden and House of Isis, Lucas

Samuel Dinsmoor's eerie sculptures and the House of Isis with creepy dolls create a spooky atmosphere.

John Wornall House

One of the oldest haunted sites in Kansas City, witnesses report seeing armed soldiers from the Civil War era and disappearing ghosts.

Osawatomie State Mental Hospital

The road to Asylum Bridge, leading to the hospital, is said to be haunted. The bridge itself adds to the eerie ambiance.

scraped_articles.title: 5 Best Pets For Small Spaces And Apartments Other Than Cats And Dogs
scraped_articles.meta_description: Here are some great pet option for those who live in a small space or apartment.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: Pets For Small Spaces and Apartment,Pet,Animal
scraped_articles.content:
5 Best Pets For Small Spaces And Apartments Other Than Cats And Dogs

Having a pet can make your day colorful. But if you live in a small room or apartment, choosing a perfect pet can be tricky. (Photo by Nikolett Emmert on Pexels)

5 Best Pets For Small Spaces And Apartments Other Than Cats And Dogs

Perfect Pet For Small Rooms And Apartments

If you live in a small space like an apartment, you might think that cats and dogs are the only options for furry companionship. But guess what? There are plenty of other fantastic pets that can bring joy and love to your home! In this article, we'll uncover some incredible creatures that make perfect pals for small spaces, according to various sources, Monday (17/7/2023). Let's explore the best pets for small spaces and apartments beyond cats and dogs!

1. Betta Fish

Betta fish is a native fish of Southeast Asia. It's famous for its colorful skin, beautiful long fins, and elegant appearance, which is perfect for decorating your room. (Photo by Thang Cao on Pexels)

Betta Fish

he best thing about betta fish is that it only needs a small tank and is very easy to maintain, making it a perfect option for those who live in a small room. You just need to provide them with a suitable tank, clean water, and a nutritious diet. (Image by Natthapat Aphichayananthanakul from Pixabay)

2. Hamster

Hamsters are one of the best options for those who live in a small room. They are small and do not need a big space. They are also quiet and very easy to keep. According to Spruce Pets, you only need to provide a small cage with an exercise wheel, items to chew, bedding, a hiding spot, food, and water. (Image by Christine Trewer from Pixabay)

3. Geckos

Geckos are a popular choice for beginners. It's also a great pet option to keep in a small room, depending on the type. Leopard geckos are a very popular choice for small spaces. They are small and friendly, and only need a special tank with warmth and places to hide. (Photo by David Bartus on Pexels)

If you love exotic pets, small snakes can be a good choice for you. Small snakes don't need a big tank to live. Small snakes are also very easy to keep as they don't need exercise. You only need to provide a comfortable space and enough food for them. Some types of small snakes that can be a great option are corn snakes and Ball Pythons. (Photo by Christian Montes on Pexels)

4. Small Snakes

5. Guinea Pigs

If you want a cute, furry pet, you can choose Guinea pigs. They are small, gentle, and love to interact with their human companions. They don't need a large amount of space, making them a perfect pet for your small room. (Photo by Karlijn Prot on Unsplash)

A spacious cage or hutch with plenty of room to move around is essential. They also need a cozy hiding spot, soft bedding, and some toys to keep them entertained. Guinea pigs are social animals, so it's best to have at least two guinea pigs together to keep each other company. (Photo by Karlijn Prot on Unsplash)

scraped_articles.title: Emma Roberts Movies and TV Shows: The 7 Best of Emma Roberts
scraped_articles.meta_description: Here are some of the best Emma Roberts movies and TV shows you need to watch.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: Emma Roberts Movies And TV Shows,Emma Roberts Movies,Emma Roberts
scraped_articles.content:
Emma Roberts Movies and TV Shows: The 7 Best of Emma Roberts

Emma Roberts Movies and TV Shows: The 7 Best of Emma Roberts

If you're a fan of Emma Roberts, you're in for a treat!

Emma Roberts is a talented actress who has appeared in various projects throughout her career. Let's take a look at some of the best Emma Roberts movies and TV shows that you definitely don't want to miss.

1. Scream 4 (2011)

(Available on: Max, Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Scream 4 

In this fourth installment of the iconic horror franchise, Emma Roberts plays Jill Roberts, a high school student who finds herself at the center of a new string of Ghostface killings. With plenty of twists and turns, "Scream 4" is a suspenseful and thrilling ride that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

2. Who We Are Now (2017)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Who We Are Now

In this powerful drama, Emma Roberts stars as Jess, a young woman trying to rebuild her life after serving time in prison. "Who We Are Now" is a poignant exploration of redemption, forgiveness, and the bonds that connect us as human beings.

3. We're The Millers (2013)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

We're The Millers 

In this hilarious comedy, Emma Roberts plays Casey Mathis, a runaway teenager who gets roped into a fake family road trip with a group of misfits. "We're The Millers" is full of laughs, unexpected twists, and heartwarming moments that make it a must-watch for fans of comedy.

4. Unfabulous (2004-2007)

(Available on: Amazon Prime Video and Apple TV)

Unfabulous

"Unfabulous" is a teen sitcom that follows the life of Addie Singer, played by Emma Roberts, as she navigates the ups and downs of adolescence. This series is the one that launched her name as an actress in the industry. With its relatable characters and witty humor, this TV show is perfect for anyone who enjoys an excellent coming-of-age story.

5. American Horror Story (2013-Present)

(Available on: Hulu, Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

American Horror Story

"American Horror Story" is a big hit TV anthology series that tells multiple horror stories. Emma Roberts has appeared in various seasons of the series and plays several different roles. From the teen Witch Madison Montgomery to the ambitious Serena Belinda, she really shows her talent and versatility as an actress in this series.

6. Holidate (2020)

(Available on: Netflix)

Holidate

In this charming holiday rom-com, Emma Roberts stars as Sloane, a single woman who strikes up a deal with a stranger to be each other's platonic plus-ones for various holiday gatherings. "Holidate" is a fun and festive film that will leave you feeling warm and fuzzy inside.

7. Scream Queens (2015-2016)

(Available on: Hulu, Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Scream Queens 

In this satirical horror-comedy TV series, Emma Roberts plays Chanel Oberlin, the queen bee of a sorority house plagued by a series of mysterious murders. With its sharp wit, dark humor, and over-the-top fashion, "Scream Queens" is a delightfully twisted show that is sure to keep you entertained.

scraped_articles.title: Thankful Thursday Quotes: Weekly Reminders to Inspire Gratitude
scraped_articles.meta_description: Thursdays offer a perfect opportunity to pause and reflect on the blessings surrounding us.
scraped_articles.content:
Thankful Thursday Quotes: Weekly Reminders to Inspire Gratitude

Thankful Thursday Quotes: Weekly Reminders to Inspire Gratitude

As the week progresses and the weekend nears, Thursdays offer a perfect opportunity to pause and reflect on the blessings surrounding us. In this collection of "Thankful Thursday Quotes," we find weekly reminders to cultivate a mindset of gratitude for the graces in our lives. These quotes also remind us to appreciate the goodness in our lives.

Please look at these insightful, Thankful Thursday quotes to guide us toward a brighter and more grateful outlook on life. Check it out!

Best Thankful Thursday Quotes

1. “Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it’s all an experience.” – Roy T. Bennett

2. “The two words that will change your life are "thank you". Like a candle that can light a thousand more without shortening its own life, appreciation is a gift that, when given, can set the whole world aglow.” – Stacey Lee

3. "There is always, always, always something to be thankful for." - Unknown

4. "The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness." - Dalai Lama

5. "In the end, it's not happy people who are thankful; it's thankful people who are happy." - Unknown

6. "The thankful heart opens our eyes to a multitude of blessings that continually surround us." - James E. Faust

7. "Thankfulness is the beginning of happiness." - Unknown

8. "The more you practice gratitude, the more you see how much there is to be grateful for." - Unknown

9. "Every day may not be good, but there's something good in every day." - Alice Morse Earle

10. "Thankfulness creates gratitude, which generates contentment that causes peace." - Todd Stocker

11. "When you focus on gratitude, the tide of disappointment goes out, and the tide of love rushes in." - Kristin Armstrong

12. "Gratitude is the inward feeling of kindness received. Thankfulness is the natural impulse to express that feeling." - Henry Van Dyke

13. “Life is a web of intersections and choices. Your 1st choice is to recognize an intersection. Your 2nd choice is to be grateful for it.” – Ryan Lilly

14. “When you focus on gratitude, positive things flow in more readily, making you even more grateful.” – Lissa Rankin

15. “We must find time to stop and thank the people who make a difference in our lives.” – John F. Kennedy

Thankful Thursday Quotes to Inspire Gratitude

1. “‘Count your blessings’ is such a common expression that it has become a catchphrase. Yet it contains powerful truth and meaning: Be grateful for what you have – and for what you don't have.” - Robert W. Bly

2. “Breath is the finest gift of nature. Be grateful for this wonderful gift.” – Amit Ray

3. “Gratitude means to recognize the good in your life, be thankful for whatever you have, some people may not even have one of those things you consider precious to you (love, family, friends, etc). Each day give thanks for the gift of life. You are blessed” - Pablo

4. "Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it." - William Arthur Ward

5. "Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings." - William Arthur Ward

6. "Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life." - Melody Beattie

7. “Display, a life full of gratitude, and remember to give thanks each day.” – Danielle Duckery

8. “Living in a state of gratitude is the gateway to grace.” - Arianna Huffington

9. “The real gift of gratitude is that the more grateful you are, the more present you become.” - Robert Holden

10. “Gratitude opens the door to the power, the wisdom, the creativity of the universe. You open the door through gratitude.” – Deepak Chopra

11. “The practice of gratitude empowers, heals, inspires, and fosters heartfelt well–being.” – Angeles Arrien

12. "To get happier, try gratitude, giving back, savoring, encouraging your optimism, and celebrating progress." – Jonathan Harnum

13. “I turned my attention to gratitude and discovered that the more I cultivated a sense of appreciation for all that I had, the happier and less fearful I was.” – M. J. Ryan

14. “It takes a lot of courage to have an attitude of gratitude during the dark times. But once you have it, it empowers you.” – Joshua Tongol

15. "Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation." - Brian Tracy

As we conclude our journey through these Thankful Thursday quotes, let us carry the spirit of gratitude into the days ahead. May these weekly reminders inspire us to pause, reflect, and appreciate all the blessings in our lives.















Author: Rizki Amelia Putri (Intern)

scraped_articles.title: HMD and Heineken Creates Unique Device Called "Boring Phone". What Is That?
scraped_articles.meta_description: There are several nostalgic features that people may find it antique.
scraped_articles.content:
HMD and Heineken Creates Unique Device Called "Boring Phone". What Is That?

There are several nostalgic features that people may find it antique.

HMD and Heineken Creates Unique Device Called "Boring Phone". What Is That?

No apps, no browsers, and no emails.

As reported by The Verge, "The Boring Phone" was created from a collaboration between HMD, Heineken, and Bodega.

Like its name, this unique device gives users the nostalgic yet boring experience because it only has several features like the retro cellphones without apps, browsers, and emails.

Even so, there are still several features that people may find it antique.

There’s a 2.8-inch QVGA display on the inside, a 1.77-inch display on the outside, a 0.3-megapixel camera, and a 3.5mm headphone jack.

The device even supports calling and texting via 2G, 3G, and 4G.

According to Heineken's website, 'The Boring Phone' will only be available through giveaways and isn’t going on sale.

It’s also a limited edition run and Heineken’s website indicates 5,000 will be made.

The Boring Phone will be available through social media giveaways in the UK, with other markets to follow later in the year.

scraped_articles.title: German Artist Travels the World to Renovate Buildings with Lego
scraped_articles.meta_description: In the hands of German artist Jan Vormann, Lego can be turned into material to repair damaged structures.
scraped_articles.content:
German Artist Travels the World to Renovate Buildings with Lego

German Artist Travels the World to Renovate Buildings with Lego

Lego is not just a classic toy that children love. In the hands of German artist Jan Vormann, Lego can be turned into material to repair damaged structures.

Vormann looks for damaged sides of buildings and fills them with Lego pieces made of plastic.

trstdly.com


As a result, the initially unattractive side becomes colorful. According to Appartment Therapy, his creative project is called Dispatchwork.

His work can be seen worldwide, mostly in narrow cracks or old cracked walls. The artist has visited over 40 cities across Europe, Asia, and beyond.

The Lego pieces "patch up" damaged walls or structures and give them another artistic look.

Some of his installations are built from toy pieces weighing up to 10 kilograms.

trstdly.com

The artist describes his work as a unique way to enjoy public spaces again.

"Dispatchwork aims to bring back childhood memories in abstract forms and bright colors," says Vormann.

He has been using Lego game pieces to revitalize spaces and structures worldwide since 2007.

trstdly.com


Through an interactive website, every building or structure repaired with Lego pieces can be recognized.

In addition, he also claims that many people were inspired to use his Lego pieces to repair the damaged parts found.

trstdly.com

scraped_articles.title: 5 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal: A Magical Tour to Experience
scraped_articles.meta_description: Take a magical tour through Kodaikanal's wonders, where spirituality, nature, and history combine.
scraped_articles.content:
5 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal: A Magical Tour to Experience

5 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal: A Magical Tour to Experience

Nestled in the Western Ghats, Kodaikanal invites you with its mystical charm.

Kodaikanal offers a calm escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. The 'Princess of Hill Stations' has a magical journey through its leafy landscapes and delightful attractions. Join us as we explore five beautiful places to visit in Kodaikanal. Each destination promises a unique experience. It resonates with the relaxation and beauty of this charming destination.

Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

Just 3 km from the mesmerizing Kodaikanal Lake lies Kurinji Andavar Murugan Temple. It is a divine sanctuary amidst nature's canvas.

1. Kurinji Andavar Murugan Temple Kodaikanal

This temple is a spiritual haven with a breathtaking backdrop. Constructed in 1936, this Hindu temple is dedicated to Lord Muruga. He is the 'God of the hills.'

Surrounded by the scenic beauty of Kurinji flowers, the temple is famous for these blossoms that grace the area once every 12 years.

Gaze at the picturesque Palani and Vaigai dams from the temple premises. It is where spirituality seamlessly blends with the natural wonders of Kodaikanal.

Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

abhinav-unsplash

2. Pillar Rocks Road Kodaikanal: Nature's Majestic Monoliths

In the heart of the 'Princess of Hill Station,' the Pillar Rocks stand tall and proud. These rocks soar 400 feet into the sky and are a natural spectacle. These granite rock formations create a beautiful vista and are ideal for a relaxing picnic.

From the vantage point of Pillar Rock, see the calm beauty of Kodaikanal growing below. The three rocks, standing shoulder to shoulder, create a fantastic panorama, with the gap between them aptly named the 'Devil's Kitchen.'

3. Kodaikanal Hill Station

Kodaikanal welcomes visitors with its calm, misty weather, rolling hills, and verdant forests.

There is an area known as the "Prince of Hill Stations." The scenic beauty of its surroundings mesmerizes you throughout the year. Visitors can explore the peaceful air of the hills and breathe in the crisp mountain air. You can also engage yourself in the charm of this hill station that reigns as a sanctuary for nature lovers.

Discover the village of Vattakanal. This spot offers panoramic views of hills, valleys, and lush forests. Vattakanal is a haven for nature buffs and photography enthusiasts. This village boasts attractions like Dolphin's Nose, a unique rock formation.

4. Vattakanal Waterfalls: Nature's Symphony in a Village

It provide expansive vistas, and the famous Vattakanal Waterfalls. Located 3 km from Kodaikanal, these falls are embraced by rich biodiversity. The waterfall invites visitors to see nature's wonders amid the relaxing sounds of water and the rustling leaves of the surrounding greenery.

Situated in the southwestern part of Kodaikanal, the Pine Forest shows a century-old plantation. This spot invites visitors to revel in the dramatic charm of tall pines.

5. Pine Forest Kodaikanal: A Century-Old Symphony of Whispers

They are famous for activities like horse riding, walking, and photography; these beautiful woods echo the whispers of nature. Engage yourself in the idyllic surroundings, where the rustling pine needles create a calm melody. Pine Forest offers a relaxing rest in the green embrace of Kodaikanal.

Take a magical tour through Kodaikanal's wonders, where spirituality, nature, and history combine. These places create a beautiful tapestry of experiences. These places tell the essence of Kodaikanal – a destination that beats the ordinary. They invite travelers to engage themselves in the timeless charm of this hill station.

Do you plan to explore divine temples, see majestic rock formations, or walk through century-old pine forests? Each place to visit in Kodaikanal promises a magical journey that resonates with the soul.

scraped_articles.title: Top 5 Haunted Hotels In India, Perfect For Ghost Hunters
scraped_articles.meta_description: From the famous Taj Mahal Hotel in Mumbai to the beautiful Hotel Savoy in Mussoorie, here are some of the most haunted hotels in India.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: Most Haunted Hotels In India,Haunted Hotels In India,Haunted Hotels
scraped_articles.content:
Top 5 Haunted Hotels In India, Perfect For Ghost Hunters

Top 5 Haunted Hotels In India, Perfect For Ghost Hunters

India is the land of myth where the mystical and supernatural often intertwine with the everyday. Among the numerous tales of haunted places, haunted hotels stand out as intriguing destinations for those seeking an otherworldly experience.

In this article, we will explore some of the most haunted hotels in India, unveiling the enigmatic stories that linger within their walls. Are you bold enough to spend a night in their haunting embrace?

The Taj Mahal Palace Hotel in Mumbai is renowned for its luxury and opulence. However, hidden within its grandeur lies a haunting tale that has intrigued many.

1. Taj Mahal Palace Hotel, Mumbai

W.A.Chambers And The Taj Mahal Palace Hotel

The Taj Mahal Palace Hotel is known as one of the most haunted spots in Mumbai. Some say that the Taj Mahal Palace Hotel is haunted by the spirit of W.A. Chambers. He was the main architect of the hotel. Legend said that he approved the layout of the hotel before he went on a short trip to the United Kingdom. When he was back, he realized that the hotel was facing the opposite direction.

Haunted by his guilt, Chambers chooses to take his own life by jumping from the 5th floor.

Since then, people claim that his spirit still lives in the hotel, roaming around the hall.

2. Hotel Fern Hill, Ooty

Hotel Fern Hill, or the Fernhills Palace, is a luxurious hotel located in the town of Ooty, Tamil Nadu. This hotel was the summer residence for the Maharaja of Mysore.

This elegant building is famous for its striking architecture and an eerie reputation that sends shivers down the spine of those who visit. One of the most intriguing tales involves the shooting of the famous movie "Raaz."

During the film's production, the crew reported strange occurrences. They claimed to hear constant furniture moving and rearranging noises from the floor above them. But when they complained to the hotel's reception, they were met with a baffling revelation – there was no floor above them. Since then, the story of the haunted Fern Hill Hotel become much more popular.

3. Morgan House Tourist Lodge, Kalimpong

The Morgan House Tourist Lodge Hotel is a beautiful British mansion located in Kalimpong, West Bengal. It was built as a summer retreat for a British plantation owner, George Morgan, in the 1930s.

The Ghost of Lady Morgan

Behind its beautiful architecture, the Morgan House is surrounded by spooky tales. One such tale revolves around Lady Morgan, George Morgan's wife, who tragically passed away at a young age. According to reports in the Times of India, some believe she endured torment at the hands of her husband before she died.

Today, people claim that her vengeful spirit still haunts the mansion. While no one ever sees her ghost, many claim they hear her footsteps walking around the wooden-floor corridor while wearing high heels.

4. Brij Raj Bhavan Palace, Kota

Brij Raj Bhavan Palace is a historic hotel in Kota, Rajasthan. It was built in 1830 by the East India Company. It was the residence of the Royal Family of Kotah before being converted into a luxurious hotel.

Brij Raj Bhavan once was the house of Major Charles Burton, an English commander in India. According to Tusk Travel, he and his family were killed by a group of Indian soldiers who attacked the palace in 1857.

People claim that their ghosts still haunt the palace to this day. Some claim they saw mysterious figures or heard spooky sounds around the hotel. 

5. Hotel Savoy, Mussoorie

Hotel Savoy is a beautiful historic building located in Mussoorie, Uttarakhand, India. This beautiful, luxurious hotel was built in 1838.

The Mystery  of Hotel Savoy

Besides its beauty and luxury, Hotel Savoy is also known for its haunted reputation. One of the most famous stories is the tale of Miss Frances Garnett-Orme. She was a famous British spiritualist who died in room 409 in 1911. Her death was originally ruled a suicide, but there have been many rumors and theories about her death over the years. Some people believe that she was murdered, while others believe that she overdosed on drugs or alcohol.

Since her mysterious death, the Hotel Savoy gained a reputation as a haunted hotel. Some visitors claim that they heard strange noises, saw flickering lights, and felt like they were being watched.

December Zodiac Sign: Exploring the Spirit of Sagittarius

As December guides us in its charm, the star spotlight turns towards the spirit of the zodiac—Sagittarians. Born between November 22nd and December 21st, these individuals carry the flame of the fire sign. Sagittarians infuse warmth, energy, and a zest for life into the cosmic.

In exploring the December zodiac sign spirit, we explore the multifaceted personality. We will see the romantic style of Sagittarius and their elemental essence. Also, bright and shadowy facets make this sign a beautiful power in the astrological realm.

pinterest

1. Sagittarius Personality

Expansive Jupiter rules Sagittarians. They are a dynamic blend of intellect, passion, and a hint of philosophical musing. Three different types of Sagittarius Suns exist, each influenced by the placement of Mercury, the planet of communication.

Whether adorned with the investigative energy of Scorpio, the practicality of Capricorn, or the self-expression of Sagittarius itself. These individuals exude a lively and clown-y energy. Under their fun-loving exterior lies a love for freedom.

They have a dislike for rules and a natural wanderlust. These features make them born travelers and free spirits.

December Zodiac Sign

Sagittarians bring a unique blend of loyalty, honesty, and a desire for freedom in matters of the heart.

2. Sagittarius' Romance Style

Their ideal partner understands and resonates with their hope to explore the world.

Love with a Sagittarius is akin to a dream—a dynamic journey filled with bravery, a dashing path to relationships, and a persistent belief in the spice of life. These bold and helpful individuals embrace relationships. They also have an infectious zest that mirrors their love of adventure.

December Zodiac Sign

3. The Fire Sign of Sagittarius

As a fire sign, Sagittarius resonates with the brilliance and passion of its essential kin—Aries and Leo.

The energy of Sagittarius shines brightly, attracting attention and a captivating aura. But, like the flame it embodies, Sagittarius can burn fiercely. 

This fire sign is a call of light, passion, and an unwavering spirit that moves them toward new horizons.

December Zodiac Sign

4. Sagittarius' Good Personality Traits

Sagittarians boastworthy traits, including faithfulness, intelligence, strength, and a sympathetic nature. Gifted with wisdom beyond their years, their independence and knowledge blend harmoniously with their sensitivity. These qualities create a character-rich in love and uniqueness. Freedom is a hallmark attribute. They weave seamlessly into the richness of a Sagittarian's persona.

Despite their many goodnesses, impatience emerges as a weakness in Sagittarians.

5. Sagittarius' Bad Personality Traits

Their lack of discipline and carelessness can lead to spontaneous decisions.

It also impacts a tendency to become easily bored. These elements are challenging, slowing their pursuit of goals and contributing to periodic episodes of incompetence.

December Zodiac Sign

6. Sagittarius' Sexual Style

Passion and play twist in the sexual realm of Sagittarius. They are famous as natural lovers of sex.

These adventurous spirits thrive on playfulness in and out of the bedroom.

Laughter is the key to unlocking the passion within a Sagittarius. They highlight the importance of a light-hearted and joyful approach to intimacy.

December Zodiac Sign

In the bright month of December, the spirits of Sagittarius illuminate the cosmic canvas. Their positive energy, love for freedom, and strict confidence in life make them beautiful celestial beings. As we navigate the complexities of the Sagittarius spirit, may we find inspiration in their courage. We also remind ourselves of their passion and unwavering commitment to the journey—both within and beyond the stars.

scraped_articles.title: An Ancient Egyptian Statue's Face Is Said to Be Similar to Michael Jackson
scraped_articles.meta_description: An Ancient Egyptian Statue's Face Is Said to Be Similar to Michael Jackson
scraped_articles.content:
An Ancient Egyptian Statue's Face Is Said to Be Similar to Michael Jackson

An Ancient Egyptian Statue's Face Is Said to Be Similar to Michael Jackson

An ancient Egyptian statue discovered in a museum has shocked many due to its striking resemblance to pop music legend Michael Jackson.

The statue, estimated to be between 3000ando 3500 years old, has sparked various speculations and conspiracy theories that the King of Pop might be a time traveler. But is this really possible,e or is there a simple explanation behind the resemblance?

The statue, which is thought to have been carved during Egypt's New Kingdom period between 1550 BC and 1050 BC, long before Michael Jackson's birth in 1958, has been the center of attention for fans of the singer.

In fact, some Michael Jackson fans went to the Chicago Field Museum in the United States, where the statue is housed, to see its resemblance to an ancient Egyptian face. Strange observations about this resemblance have not only come from fans.

Some people even tried to joke by referring to the statue as "Neferteehee," referring to the iconic "hee hee" sound that Michael Jackson often made in his songs. Others referred to the possibility of Michael Jackson walking in ancient Egypt, calling it "Walking on the moon like an Egyptian."

While conspiracy theories about Michael Jackson being a time traveler may sound intriguing, there is a more straightforward explanation for the statue's resemblance. A curator at the museum revealed that most ancient Egyptian statues and sculptures were sacred to early Christians and Muslims because they were used as idols.


The broken nose on the statue resulted from careful destruction carried out at the time as a sign that the figure was not an object of human worship.

In addition, the figure shows a woman, which suggests that the statue could not depict Michael Jackson.

The facial resemblance may be due to the general shape of ancient Egyptian sculpture at the time. The statue remains a mystery as no hieroglyphics, ancient Egyptian symbols used for writing, were found on its surface.

Archaeologists are still trying to figure out the reason behind the creation of this little statue that caught the world's attention. So, despite the exciting conspiracy theories, the sculpture may be one of the many mysteries surrounding ancient Egyptian civilization.

scraped_articles.title: 6 Colorado Springs Things to Do for the Perfect First-Timers' Plan
scraped_articles.meta_description: Colorado Springs offers first-time visitors a beautiful blend of history, natural beauty, and adventure. There are many Colorado Springs things to do.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: Colorado Springs Things to Do,Colorado,Colorado Springs,traveler,asian traveler,amazing traveler,nature,history,destination,Travelling Tips,travel news,travel places,Traveling,tour
scraped_articles.content:
6 Colorado Springs Things to Do for the Perfect First-Timers' Plan

6 Colorado Springs Things to Do for the Perfect First-Timers' Plan

Colorado Springs is a destination that calls travelers.

Colorado Springs has breathtaking natural beauty, a rich history, and unique attractions. It is nestled in the picturesque state of Colorado. If you plan your first visit to this enchanting city, you're in for a treat. In this article, we'll explore five must-see attractions in Colorado Springs. These activities ideally introduce the region's natural wonders and cultural heritage.

Let's check out some Colorado Springs things to do for first-time visitors, compiled from numerous sources, on Wednesday (20/09/2023).

The Colorado Springs Pioneers Museum is a treasure trove of history. This museum will transport you back in time. It is housed in a beautiful Neoclassical building.

1. Colorado Springs Pioneer Museum

The museum showcases the city's evolution, from its early days as a mining town to its evolution into a thriving community. Visitors can explore exhibits featuring artifacts, photographs, and interactive displays. These features bring the past to life. It's a great way to understand the city's heritage and gain insights into its transformation.
flickr/brokentaco/David

Garden of the Gods is one of the most iconic and popular natural interests in Colorado Springs. This red rock wonderland is a geological masterpiece. The Garden of Gods has towering sandstone formations. The sandstone was sculpted by the powers of nature over millions of years.

2. Garden of the Gods

Visitors can hike, bike, or take a panoramic drive through the park. Then, you can marvel at the awe-inspiring rock formations. It's an excellent place for outdoor lovers and photographers. The Garden of Gods offers countless chances for exploration and breathtaking vistas.
Photo: barefoot-beach-designs-unsplash

Visiting the Manitou Cliff Dwellings is like stepping into a time machine. This unique attraction allows you to explore preserved Ancestral Puebloan cliff dwellings. This site was relocated and reassembled at its current location.

3. Manitou Cliff Dwellings

Visitors can walk through ancient rooms, kivas, and walkways. You can also gain insights into the daily lives of the people who once called these places home. The neighboring museum provides other context and historical information. These parts make it an educational and fascinating experience for all ages.
Photo: pinterest/Chris Johnson

Seven Falls is a natural wonder. It is just a short drive from Colorado Springs. Seven Falls is known as "The Grandest Mile of Scenery in Colorado." It features a series of seven cascading waterfalls surrounded by leafy vegetation and towering cliffs.  Visitors can take a scenic hike up the canyon or ride an in-mountain elevator.

4. The Broadmoor Seven Falls

You can also enjoy the view from the platform. At night, the falls are beautifully illuminated. This moment creates a romantic and magical atmosphere. It's a must-visit for those seeking a blend of natural beauty and outdoor adventure.

Photo: flickr/Tim Caynes

flickr/CaptSpaulding

5. Cave of the Winds Mountain Park: Underground Exploration

If you're an adventurer at heart, Cave of the Winds Mountain Park is your perfect destination. Visitors can explore a series of underground caves. Each cave has its unique formations and history. Guided tours provide charming insights into the geology and folklore of the caves.

Above ground, the park offers exciting attractions like the Terror-Dactyl. Then, you will marvel at a heart-pounding canyon swing. Then you can enjoy various high-flying adventures for adrenaline junkies. It's where nature meets experience, making it an ideal stop for families and thrill-seekers.
flickr/Zach Frieben

6. Cheyenne Mountain Zoo: A Unique Animal Adventure

The Cheyenne Mountain Zoo is an exceptional zoo experience. It is located in the majestic Cheyenne Mountains.

This Colorado Springs thing to do to is suitable for nature lovers. This zoo is famous for its spectacular location and its focus on animal conservation. Here, you can get up close and personal with over 750 animals worldwide.

The zoo's location provides breathtaking views of Colorado Springs. Visitors can take a chairlift ride to the top for panoramic vistas. This feature makes it a unique zoo experience.

Colorado Springs things to do to

The zoo offers interactive exhibits and feeding options. These will allow visitors to hand-feed giraffes and interact with other animals. It's a family-friendly attraction that provides a deeper understanding of wildlife.

Photo: nathan-andress-unsplash

Colorado Springs offers first-time visitors a beautiful blend of history, natural beauty, and adventure. There are many Colorado Springs things to do to choose from.

These activities showcase the best of what the city and its surroundings have to offer. Are you interested in history, outdoor exploration, or chilling thrills? These attractions provide a well-rounded introduction to the wonders of Colorado Springs.

scraped_articles.title: 65 Questions to Ask Boyfriend Before Getting Married

scraped_articles.content:
65 Questions to Ask Boyfriend Before Getting Married

65 Questions to Ask Boyfriend Before Getting Married

Getting married is a significant step in any relationship, and it's essential to ensure both partners are on the same page. Asking the right questions can help you understand each other's expectations, values, and future goals. These questions to ask boyfriend can reveal important insights that might not come up in everyday conversations.

Before tying the knot, it's crucial to discuss topics like finances, family planning, and career aspirations. These questions to ask boyfriend can help you navigate potential challenges and avoid misunderstandings later. Open and honest communication is the foundation of a successful marriage.

In this article, we have selected some great and deep questions to ask boyfriend before getting married from various sources, Tuesday (16/7/2024).

Taking the time to ask these important questions will strengthen your bond and prepare you for a harmonious future together.

A. Reflective Questions to Ask Boyfriend Before Getting Married

. What do you think are our strengths as a couple?

2. What areas do you feel we need to work on in our relationship?

3. How do you feel we communicate with each other?

4. What can we do to improve our communication?

5. How do you feel when we disagree or argue?

6. What can we do to handle disagreements better?

7. What do you appreciate most about our relationship?

8. What do you think we can do to keep our relationship strong?

9. How can we support each other better in our personal goals?

10. What are some activities we can do together to strengthen our bond?

11. How do you feel about the balance of give and take in our relationship?

12. What can we do to ensure both of us feel valued and appreciated?

13. How do you envision our relationship evolving over the years?

14. What are some ways we can maintain romance and intimacy in our relationship?

15. How do you feel about the way we handle stress together?

16. What can we do to better support each other during tough times?

17. What are your hopes and dreams for our future together?

18. How can we ensure we grow together and not apart?

19. What traditions or routines can we establish to strengthen our relationship?

20. How do you feel about the way we spend our free time together?

21. What can we do to make sure we both have quality time together regularly?

22. How can we better understand and meet each other’s needs?

23. What are some ways we can keep our relationship fun and exciting?

24. How do you feel about the way we handle each other’s vulnerabilities and insecurities?

25. What can we do to ensure we both feel heard and understood in our relationship?

B. Important Questions to Ask Boyfriend About Marriage Life

1. What does marriage mean to you?

2. Why do you want to get married?

3. How do you envision our life together as a married couple?

4. What are your thoughts on the roles of husband and wife in a marriage?

5. How important is maintaining individuality within a marriage to you?

6. What are your expectations for our relationship after we get married?

7. How do you think marriage will change our relationship?

8. What are your thoughts on dealing with challenges and conflicts in marriage?

9. How do you feel about sharing responsibilities in marriage, such as finances and household chores?

10. What are your views on spending time with extended family after marriage?

11. How important is it to you to maintain traditions or create new ones in our marriage?

12. What are your expectations for intimacy and physical affection in our marriage?

13. How do you feel about the concept of joint decision-making in marriage?

14. How do you envision our social life as a married couple?

15. What are your thoughts on financial planning and budgeting as a married couple?

16. What are your views on work-life balance in marriage?

17. How important is it to you to have shared hobbies and interests in our marriage?

18. How do you feel about dealing with major life changes together, such as moving or changing jobs?

19. What are your thoughts on maintaining friendships and personal space in marriage?

20. How do you feel about the concept of forgiveness and making amends in marriage?

21. What are your views on raising children and parenting within a marriage?

22. How important is it to you to have a strong spiritual or religious foundation in our marriage?

23. What are your expectations for our relationship with in-laws after marriage?

24. How do you feel about the importance of regular communication and check-ins in our marriage?

25. What are your thoughts on long-term goals and aspirations for our marriage?

C. Questions to Ask Boyfriend About Finance

1. How do you feel about combining our finances after marriage?

2. What are your views on joint bank accounts versus individual accounts?

3. How do you handle budgeting and managing expenses?

4. Are you a spender or a saver?

5. How do you feel about using credit cards and managing credit card debt?

6. What is your approach to saving for big purchases or future goals?

7. What are your thoughts on financial planning for emergencies?

8. How do you feel about debt, such as student loans, car loans, or mortgages?

9. How do you envision dividing financial responsibilities in our marriage?

10. What are your long-term financial goals, such as buying a house or saving for retirement?

11. How do you feel about investing and growing our wealth?

12. What is your approach to managing unexpected expenses?

13. How do you feel about discussing and agreeing on major financial decisions together?

14. What are your thoughts on financial independence and supporting each other’s career goals?

15. How do you feel about sharing financial responsibilities, such as paying bills and managing savings?

75 Guess What Jokes That Are Best Left Unanswered

Do you love jokes that make you laugh and think at the same time? Guess what jokes are perfect for that! These jokes are simple, fun, and easy to share with friends and family. They keep you guessing and then surprise you with a clever punchline.

Guess what jokes have been popular for many years. Everyone loves them because they are lighthearted and creative. These classic jokes often start with "Guess what?" and end with a funny twist. They are great for breaking the ice or making someone smile on a bad day.

If you are looking for some lighthearted jokes that will make you laugh out loud, you come to the right place. In this article, we have selected some of the best guess what jokes from various sources, Tuesday (14/1/2025). Don't forget to share these funny jokes with those around you to make them smile.

The Best Guess What Jokes

1. Guess what the buffalo said to his son when he left for college? Bye son!

2. Guess what happens to a slug when he gets rid of his shell? He becomes a bit sluggish.

3. Guess what the biggest problem with kleptomaniacs is? They are always taking things literally!

4. Guess what? Stairs are untrustworthy! They are always up to something.

5. Guess what? The police force just hired a duck detective! He helps them to quack their cases.

6. Guess what the calendar worker got fired for? He took a day off without telling anyone!

7. Guess what Dracula's favorite fruit is? A neck-tarine!

8. Guess what the cat said when he fell off the tin roof? I'm feline fine now!

9. Guess what has four wheels and flies? A garbage truck.

10. Guess what a sea monster's favorite meal is? Fish and ships!

11. Guess what you get when you cross a Labrador with a magician's trick gone wrong? A labracadabrador!

12. Guess what musical groups a wind turbine likes to listen to? Heavy metal!

13. Guess what? I was trying to mimic a flamingo. I had to put my foot down!

14. Guess what made the moon so cold? She's always deflecting the sun's rays!

15. Guess what Tarzan said when he saw the elephants coming? Here come the elephants!

16. Guess what Robin Hood's favorite font is? Sans-sheriff!

17. Guess what happened to the shark that crossed the road? He got to the other tide.

18. Guess what happens to a frog's car when it breaks down? It gets toad away.

19. Guess what you call someone who never falls down the stairs? A stair-voyant!

20. Guess what the dentists call their x-rays? Tooth pics!

21. Guess what the chop said to the steak on their first date? It's so nice to finally meat you!

22. Guess what Santa calls his elves? Subordinate clauses!

23. Guess what the police did about the mobster buried in cement? Nothing, they don't care about hardened criminals.

24. Guess what's always coming but never arrives? Tomorrow.

25. Guess what the banana said to the doctor? I'm not peeling well.

Kid-Friendly Guess What Jokes

1. Guess what the left eye said to the right eye? Between you and me, something smells!

2. Guess what a sleeping piece of paper is called? A napkin!

3. Guess what Santa's elves learned in school? The elfabets!

4. Guess what happens when a horse falls? He can't giddy up!

5. Guess what you call a magic dog? A labracadabrador!

6. Guess what vegetable is always angry? A steamed vegetable!

7. Guess what you call a famous tortoise? A shell-ebrity!

8. Guess what you call a baby reindeer's first teeth? Buck teeth!

9. Guess what makes the moon so cold? She's always deflecting the sun's rays!

10. Guess what Dracula's favorite holiday is? Fangsgiving!

11. Guess what type of music mummies like best? Wrap music!

12. Guess what a sea monster's favorite meal is? Fish and ships!

13. Guess what happens when two monkeys share an Amazon account? They become prime mates!

14. Guess what you call a bear with no teeth? A gummy bear!

15. Guess what fruit never gets lonely? A pear!

16. Guess what happens to a frog's car when it breaks down? It gets toad away!

17. Guess what the tomato said to the baby tomato who was lagging behind? Ketchup!

18. Guess what the banana wore to the beach? A yellow peel!

19. Guess what the buffalo said when he dropped his kid off at school? Bison!

20. Guess what you call a dinosaur with an extensive vocabulary? A thesaurus!

21. Guess what kind of fish performs great tricks? A starfish!

22. Guess what you call an alligator wearing a vest? An investigator!

23. Guess what the calendar worker got fired for? He took a day off without permission!

24. Guess what Tarzan said when the elephants came running? Here come the elephants!

25. Guess what's the best thing about Switzerland? I don't know, but the flag is a big plus!

More Funny Guess What Jokes

1. Guess what you call a bird who can play music? A flamingo-tar!

2. Guess what I said to the man wearing a T-shirt? "Sir, your head is sticking out of your T-shirt!"

3. Guess what happens to a nervous ship? It becomes a wreck!

4. Guess what the geese got after falling down the stairs? Goosebumps!

5. Guess what happens when you cross a comedian and a chicken? You get someone who loves cracking jokes!

6. Guess what Cinderella said when she played soccer? "I can't stay; I'm running from the ball!"

7. Guess what a boulder, a pebble, and a stone did at a concert? They rocked and rolled all night long!

8. Guess what the pancake said to the syrup? "You're flipping sweet!"

9. Guess what the fish said when he swam into a wall? Dam!

10. Guess what the astronaut kept pressing on his computer? The space bar!

11. Guess what the clock said to the mirror? "I'm ticked off!"

12. Guess what the police officer said to the calendar thief? "Your days are numbered!"

13. Guess what happens when you eat a dictionary? You get thesaurus throat ever!

14. Guess what you call a cow that loves adventure? An udderly brave explorer!

15. Guess what the cookie said to the baker? "You're one smart cookie!"

16. Guess what type of fish never tells the truth? A lying fish!

17. Guess what you call a boomerang that doesn't come back? A stick!

18. Guess what the lightning said to the tree? "You're grounded!"

19. Guess what the janitor said when he jumped out of the closet? "Supplies!"

21. Guess what made the scarecrow win an award? He was outstanding in his field!

23. Guess what the calendar worker got promoted to? A date manager!

24. Guess what the triangle said to the circle? "You're pointless!"

25. Guess what you call a broken can opener? A can't opener!

scraped_articles.title: 5 Haunting Places in Canberra's Paranormal Landscape
scraped_articles.meta_description: Canberra has its fair share of haunted places. These spots offer a stunning blend of history and mystery.
scraped_articles.content:
5 Haunting Places in Canberra's Paranormal Landscape

5 Haunting Places in Canberra's Paranormal Landscape

Located in the heart of Australia, Canberra is known as the country's capital city and political hub.

However, beneath its modern facade lies a hidden world of scary tales and ghostly encounters. It ranges from eerie museums to historic landmarks. Canberra has its fair share of haunted places that will send shivers down your spine. Join us as we explore five haunted places in Canberra's paranormal landscape.

Haunted Places in Canberra

1. The Air Disaster Memorial

Our first stop on this journey is the Air Disaster Memorial, which marks the lives lost in flight accidents.

Many visitors have reported strange happenings, such as hearing whispers and feeling cold spots. Some claim to have seen apparitions of pilots and passengers walking the grounds. The haunting presence at the memorial serves as a reminder of the tragedies.

2. National Film and Sound Archive

Next up is the National Film and Sound Archive, a treasure trove of Australia's cinematic history. It may be home to countless movies and recordings.

But it is also rumored to house a few restless spirits. Staff members have reported unexplained footsteps, flickering lights, and objects moving on their own.

Some believe the ghosts of film lovers who passed away still linger in this spooky archive.

Haunted Places in Canberra

3. Duntroon House

Moving on, we will now take you to Duntroon House. It is a historic mansion with its fair share of ghostly tales.

Built-in the 1830s, this grand residence is said to be haunted by the spirit of Lady Denman, the wife of the Governor-General at the time.

Visitors have reported hearing footsteps and seeing shadowy figures wandering the halls. Some even claim to have felt a mysterious presence touching them. Duntroon House's creepy atmosphere adds an extra layer of intrigue to its history.

Haunted Places in Canberra

flickr/ABC Canberra

4. Blundells Cottage

Our next stop is Blundells Cottage, a charming stone cottage dating back to the 1860s. Despite its quaint appearance, this cottage has a haunting reputation. Legend has it that the ghost of Charles Campbell, an ex-owner, still lingers within its walls.

Visitors have described hearing phantom footsteps and feeling an icy chill in certain rooms.

The stories surrounding Blundells Cottage transport you back in time. Explore this site, which will give you a glimpse into Canberra's past.

Haunted Places in Canberra

5. National Museum of Australia

Last but not least, we visited the National Museum of Australia. This site shows the country's cultural heritage.

However, some artifacts may have more than just historical value.

Staff members have reported strange happenings in various parts of the museum, including unexplained noises and objects mysteriously falling off shelves. These paranormal activities are believed to be certain artifacts with dark histories.

Haunted Places in Canberra

Whether you believe in ghosts or not, Canberra has its fair share of haunted places. These spots offer a stunning blend of history and mystery. They invite visitors to a world where things are sometimes different from what they seem. So, if you are in Canberra and want to explore its paranormal landscape, visit these haunted places for an unforgettable experience. Canberra's paranormal sites will leave you with a sense of wonder and maybe even a shiver down your spine.

scraped_articles.title: 6 Easy Shrimp Recipes That You Will Love
scraped_articles.meta_description: From shrimp fried rice to shrimp tacos, let's find out some tasty and easy shrimp recipes that you will love.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: easy shrimp recipes,shrimp recipes,shrimp,how to cook shrimp
scraped_articles.content:
6 Easy Shrimp Recipes That You Will Love

Are you looking for easy shrimp recipes that you can make at home without spending hours in the kitchen? Shrimp is one of the best ingredients for quick cooking because it takes only a few minutes to prepare. These simple dishes are perfect for busy weekdays or when you want to impress guests.

Many people think cooking seafood is difficult, but easy shrimp recipes prove this wrong. Shrimp cooks very fast and works well with many different flavors and cooking methods. You can fry, boil, grill, or bake shrimp to create delicious meals.

In this article, we will share six easy shrimp recipes that you will love. From the shrimp fried rice to shrimp tacos, you can find easy recipes from various parts of the world. We gathered these recipes from various sources, Thursday (3/7/2025).

Old Bay Shrimp Boil Recipe

This classic shrimp boil brings the taste of the coast to your kitchen. Old Bay seasoning gives the shrimp a perfect blend of spices that makes this dish unforgettable.

Ingredients:

- 2 pounds large shrimp, shells on

- 4 tablespoons Old Bay seasoning

- 1 lemon, cut into wedges

- 4 garlic cloves, minced

- 8 cups water

- 2 tablespoons salt

- 2 tablespoons butter

Instructions:

1. Fill a large pot with water and add salt. Bring the water to a rolling boil over high heat.

2. Add Old Bay seasoning and minced garlic to the boiling water. Stir well to mix all the flavors together.

3. Carefully add the shrimp to the pot. The shells help keep the shrimp tender and add extra flavor to the dish.

4. Cook the shrimp for 2-3 minutes until they turn pink and curl slightly. Do not overcook them or they will become tough.

5. Remove the shrimp from the pot using a large spoon with holes. Place them on a serving plate immediately.

6. Melt butter in a small pan and pour it over the hot shrimp. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing over the shrimp.

Easy Garlic Butter Shrimp Recipe

This garlic butter shrimp recipe is ready in less than 10 minutes. The combination of garlic and butter creates a rich sauce that makes the shrimp taste amazing.

Ingredients:

- 1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

- 4 tablespoons butter

- 4 garlic cloves, minced

- 2 tablespoons olive oil

- 1 teaspoon salt

- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper

- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped

- 1 lemon, juiced

Instructions:

1. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Make sure the oil covers the bottom of the pan evenly.

2. Add minced garlic to the hot oil and cook for 30 seconds. Stir constantly so the garlic does not burn.

3. Add the shrimp to the pan in a single layer. Season with salt and pepper on both sides.

4. Cook the shrimp for 2 minutes on one side until they start to turn pink. Flip them over carefully with tongs.

5. Add butter to the pan and let it melt around the shrimp. The butter will mix with the garlic and oil to create a sauce.

6. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the shrimp are completely pink and cooked through.

7. Remove from heat and add lemon juice and chopped parsley. Toss everything together and serve immediately.

Shrimp Fried Rice Recipe

This shrimp fried rice turns leftover rice into a complete meal. It combines protein, vegetables, and rice in one delicious dish that the whole family will enjoy.

Ingredients:

- 1 pound small shrimp, peeled and deveined

- 3 cups cooked rice, preferably day-old

- 2 eggs, beaten

- 1 cup mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, corn)

- 3 green onions, chopped

- 3 tablespoons soy sauce

- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil

- 1 tablespoon sesame oil

- 2 garlic cloves, minced

- 1 teaspoon ginger, minced

Instructions:

1. Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over high heat. The pan should be very hot for proper frying.

2. Add beaten eggs to the hot oil and scramble them quickly. Remove the cooked eggs from the pan and set aside.

3. Add the remaining oil to the same pan. Add minced garlic and ginger, stirring for 30 seconds until fragrant.

4. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes until they turn pink. Season with a pinch of salt.

5. Add the mixed vegetables to the pan and stir-fry for 2 minutes until they are heated through but still crisp.

6. Add the cooked rice to the pan, breaking up any clumps with a spoon. Stir everything together well.

7. Pour soy sauce and sesame oil over the rice mixture. Add the scrambled eggs back to the pan.

8. Stir-fry everything together for 2-3 minutes until the rice is heated through. Top with chopped green onions before serving.

Shrimp Taco Recipe

These shrimp tacos bring Mexican flavors to your dinner table. The spiced shrimp pairs perfectly with fresh toppings for a light and satisfying meal.

Ingredients:

- 1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

- 8 small corn or flour tortillas

- 1 teaspoon chili powder

- 1 teaspoon cumin

- 1/2 teaspoon paprika

- 1/2 teaspoon salt

- 2 tablespoons olive oil

- 1 cup shredded cabbage

- 1 avocado, sliced

- 1/4 cup red onion, diced

- 1/4 cup cilantro, chopped

- 2 limes, cut into wedges

- 1/2 cup sour cream

Instructions:

1. Mix chili powder, cumin, paprika, and salt in a small bowl. This spice mixture will give the shrimp a delicious Mexican flavor.

2. Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels and place them in a large bowl. Sprinkle the spice mixture over the shrimp.

3. Toss the shrimp with your hands until they are evenly coated with all the spices.

4. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned shrimp to the hot oil.

5. Cook the shrimp for 2-3 minutes on each side until they are pink and slightly charred on the edges.

6. Warm the tortillas in a dry pan for 30 seconds on each side or wrap them in damp paper towels and microwave for 30 seconds.

7. Fill each tortilla with 3-4 shrimp. Top with shredded cabbage, avocado slices, diced red onion, and cilantro.

8. Serve with lime wedges and sour cream on the side. Squeeze lime juice over the tacos before eating.

Shrimp Cocktail Recipe

This classic shrimp cocktail makes an elegant appetizer for any occasion. The tangy cocktail sauce complements the sweet, tender shrimp perfectly.

Ingredients:

- 2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined

- 8 cups water

- 2 tablespoons salt

- 1 lemon, halved

- 2 bay leaves

- 1/2 cup ketchup

- 2 tablespoons horseradish

- 1 tablespoon lemon juice

- 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce

- 1/4 teaspoon hot sauce

- Ice for serving

Instructions:

1. Fill a large pot with water and add salt, bay leaves, and lemon halves. Bring to a boil over high heat.

2. Add the shrimp to the boiling water and cook for 2-3 minutes until they turn pink and curl into a C shape.

3. Immediately remove the shrimp with a slotted spoon and place them in a bowl of ice water. This stops the cooking process.

4. Let the shrimp cool in the ice water for 5 minutes, then drain and pat them dry with paper towels.

5. To make cocktail sauce, mix ketchup, horseradish, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce in a small bowl.

6. Taste the sauce and adjust the horseradish or hot sauce to your preference. The sauce should be tangy and slightly spicy.

7. Arrange the cooked shrimp around the edge of a serving plate with the cocktail sauce in the center.

8. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 hours before serving. Keep the shrimp on ice if serving at a party.

Easy Coconut Shrimp Recipe

This coconut shrimp recipe creates a crispy, tropical-flavored dish that feels special but is simple to make. The sweet coconut coating makes these shrimp irresistible.

Ingredients:

- 1 pound large shrimp, peeled with tails on

- 1 cup all-purpose flour

- 2 eggs, beaten

- 1 1/2 cups shredded coconut

- 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs

- 1 teaspoon salt

- 1/2 teaspoon pepper

- Vegetable oil for frying

- Sweet chili sauce for dipping

Instructions:

1. Set up three shallow dishes for coating the shrimp. Put flour mixed with salt and pepper in the first dish.

2. Place beaten eggs in the second dish. Mix shredded coconut and panko breadcrumbs in the third dish.

3. Pat the shrimp dry and hold each one by the tail. Dip it first in flour, then egg, then coconut mixture.

4. Press the coconut coating gently onto each shrimp to help it stick well. Place coated shrimp on a plate.

5. Heat 2 inches of oil in a heavy pot to 350°F. Use a cooking thermometer to check the temperature.

6. Fry 4-5 shrimp at a time for 2-3 minutes until they are golden brown and floating on top of the oil.

7. Remove the shrimp with a slotted spoon and place them on paper towels to drain excess oil.

8. Serve immediately with sweet chili sauce for dipping. The shrimp are best when eaten hot and crispy.
